alert.note: Alert for Northern Clearwater Mountains; Orofino, Grangeville Region; Southern Clearwater Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 2:58PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Idaho and southwestern Clearwater Counties through 245 PM PDT... At 157 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 15 miles east of Pierce, or 30 miles northeast of Kamiah, moving southwest at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pierce, Weippe, Lowell, Musselshell, Cardiff, Jaype, Glenwood and Syringa. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Northern Clearwater Mountains; Orofino, Grangeville Region; Southern Clearwater Mountains
